data.title: Thigmoo by Eugene Byrne
data.meta_description: Thigmoo by Byrne, Eugene and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Paperback. Condition: Good. 345 pages. Cover wornWhat an idea - the Museum of the Mind. At the University of Wessex, Sir John Westgate and Dr Katharine Beckford have spent ten years using computer power and AIs to create over 200 fictional characters from all periods of history, known as 'erams', who interact with their questioners as a real person .

Paperback. Condition: Very Good. 352 pages. At the University of Wessex, Sir John Westgate and Dr Katherine Beckford have used computer power to create over 200 fictional characters from all periods of history, known as erams, who respond to questions as a real human being would. With such a wonderful idea, something is bound to go wrong.

Paperback. Condition: Good. 'What an idea - the Museum of the Mind. At the University of Wessex, Sir John Westgate and Dr Katharine Beckford have spent ten years using computer power and AIs to create over 200 fictional characters from all periods of history, known as 'erams', who interact with their questioners as a real person would. Soliders, parsons, dockers, even a Victorian tart with a heart. For Dr Beckford, it's a wonderful use of artificial intelligence and a superb learning tool. For Sir John, it's a wonderful use of university funds and a superb way to make money (and gain personal honours). Something was bound to go wrong. When a number of erams escape into the world's computer net, and become self aware, it seems that the outbreak can be contained - but life is never that simple. The university authorities should never have attempted to destroy them.'--Page 4 of cover. 352 pages.

Condition: Good. SHIPS FROM USA. Used books have different signs of use and do not include supplemental materials such as CDs, Dvds, Access Codes, charts or any other extra material. All used books might have various degrees of writing, highliting and wear and tear and possibly be an ex-library with the usual stickers and stamps. Dust Jackets are not guaranteed and when still present, they will have various degrees of tear and damage. All images are Stock Photos, not of the actual item. book.
